00001 /**
00002  * @file ccnsendchunks.c
00003  * Injects chunks of data from stdin into ccn
00004  *
00005  * A CCNx command-line utility.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (C) 2008-2010 Palo Alto Research Center, Inc.
00008  *

00020 #include <errno.h>
00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 #include <stdlib.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <unistd.h>
00025 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00026 #include <ccn/uri.h>
00027 #include <ccn/keystore.h>
00028 #include <ccn/signing.h>
00029 
00030 struct mydata {
00031     int content_received;
00032     int content_sent;
00033     int outstanding;
00034 };
00035 
00036 enum ccn_upcall_res
00037 incoming_content(
00038     struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00039     enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00040     struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00041 {
00042     struct mydata *md = selfp->data;
00043 
00044     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL)
00045         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00046     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT)
00047         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00048     if ((kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT && kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED) || md == NULL)
00049         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00050     md->content_received++;
00051     ccn_set_run_timeout(info->h, 0);
00052     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00053 }
00054 
00055 enum ccn_upcall_res
00056 incoming_interest(
00057     struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00058     enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00059     struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00060 {
00061     struct mydata *md = selfp->data;
00062 
00063     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL)
00064         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00065     if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST || md == NULL)
00066         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00067     if ((info->pi->answerfrom & CCN_AOK_NEW) != 0) {
00068         if (md->outstanding < 10)
00069             md->outstanding = 10;
00070         ccn_set_run_timeout(info->h, 0);
00071     }
00072     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00073 }
00074 
00075 ssize_t
00076 read_full(int fd, unsigned char *buf, size_t size)
00077 {
00078     size_t i;
00079     ssize_t res = 0;
00080     for (i = 0; i < size; i += res) {
00081         res = read(fd, buf + i, size - i);
00082         if (res == -1) {
00083             if (errno == EAGAIN || errno == EINTR)
00084                 res = 0;
00085             else
00086                 return(res);
00087         }
00088         else if (res == 0)
00089             break;
00090     }
00091     return(i);
00092 }
00093 
00094 static void
00095 usage(const char *progname)
00096 {
00097         fprintf(stderr,
00098                 "%s [-h] [-x freshness_seconds] [-b blocksize] URI\n"
00099                 " Chops stdin into blocks (1K by default) and sends them "
00100                 "as consecutively numbered ContentObjects "
00101                 "under the given uri\n", progname);
00102         exit(1);
00103 }
00104 
00105 int
00106 main(int argc, char **argv)
00107 {
00108     const char *progname = argv[0];
00109     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00110     struct ccn_charbuf *root = NULL;
00111     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00112     struct ccn_charbuf *temp = NULL;
00113     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00114     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00115     long expire = -1;
00116     long blocksize = 1024;
00117     int i;
00118     int status = 0;
00119     int res;
00120     ssize_t read_res;
00121     unsigned char *buf = NULL;
00122     struct mydata mydata = { 0 };
00123     struct ccn_closure in_content = {.p=&incoming_content, .data=&mydata};
00124     struct ccn_closure in_interest = {.p=&incoming_interest, .data=&mydata};
00125     while ((res = getopt(argc, argv, "hx:b:")) != -1) {
00126         switch (res) {
00127             case 'x':
00128                 expire = atol(optarg);
00129                 if (expire <= 0)
00130                     usage(progname);
00131                 break;
00132             case 'b':
00133                 blocksize = atol(optarg);
00134                 break;
00135             default:
00136             case 'h':
00137                 usage(progname);
00138                 break;
00139         }
00140     }
00141     argc -= optind;
00142     argv += optind;
00143     if (argc != 1)
00144         usage(progname);
00145     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00146     res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, argv[0]);
00147     if (res < 0) {
00148         fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad CCN URI: %s\n", progname, argv[0]);
00149         exit(1);
00150     }
00151     ccn = ccn_create();
00152     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00153         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00154         exit(1);
00155     }
00156     
00157     buf = calloc(1, blocksize);
00158     root = name;
00159     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00160     temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00161     templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
00162 
00163     /* Set up a handler for interests */
00164     ccn_charbuf_append(name, root->buf, root->length);
00165     ccn_set_interest_filter(ccn, name, &in_interest);
00166     
00167     /* Initiate check to see whether there is already something there. */
00168     ccn_charbuf_reset(temp);
00169     ccn_charbuf_putf(temp, "%d", 0);
00170     ccn_name_append(name, temp->buf, temp->length);
00171     ccn_charbuf_reset(templ);
00172     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest);
00173     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name);
00174     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Name> */
00175     ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_MaxSuffixComponents, "%d", 1);
00176     // XXX - use pubid
00177     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Interest> */
00178     res = ccn_express_interest(ccn, name, &in_content, templ);
00179     if (res < 0) abort();
00180     
00181     sp.freshness = expire;
00182     for (i = 0;; i++) {
00183         read_res = read_full(0, buf, blocksize);
00184         if (read_res < 0) {
00185             perror("read");
00186             read_res = 0;
00187             status = 1;
00188         }
00189         if (read_res < blocksize) {
00190             sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00191         }
00192         ccn_charbuf_reset(name);
00193         ccn_charbuf_append(name, root->buf, root->length);
00194         ccn_charbuf_reset(temp);
00195         ccn_charbuf_putf(temp, "%d", i);
00196         ccn_name_append(name, temp->buf, temp->length);
00197         ccn_charbuf_reset(temp);
00198         ccn_charbuf_append(temp, buf, read_res);
00199         ccn_charbuf_reset(temp);
00200         res = ccn_sign_content(ccn, temp, name, &sp, buf, read_res);
00201         if (res != 0) {
00202             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to sign ContentObject (res == %d)\n", res);
00203             exit(1);
00204         }
00205         /* Put the keylocator in the first block only. */
00206         sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_OMIT_KEY_LOCATOR;
00207         if (i == 0) {
00208             /* Finish check for old content */
00209             if (mydata.content_received == 0)
00210                 ccn_run(ccn, 100);
00211             if (mydata.content_received > 0) {
00212                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: name is in use: %s\n", progname, argv[0]);
00213                 exit(1);
00214             }
00215             mydata.outstanding++; /* the first one is free... */
00216         }
00217         res = ccn_put(ccn, temp->buf, temp->length);
00218         if (res < 0) {
00219             fprintf(stderr, "ccn_put failed (res == %d)\n", res);
00220             exit(1);
00221         }
00222         if (read_res < blocksize)
00223             break;
00224         if (mydata.outstanding > 0)
00225             mydata.outstanding--;
00226         else
00227             res = 10;
00228         res = ccn_run(ccn, res * 100);
00229         if (res < 0) {
00230             status = 1;
00231             break;
00232         }
00233     }
00234     
00235     free(buf);
00236     buf = NULL;
00237     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&root);
00238     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00239     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00240     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00241     exit(status);
00242 }
